headline.main: Russia's Future Discussed; More Appreciation of Individual Rights and Initiative Seen There

lead_paragraph: TO THE EDITOR OF THE NEW YORK TIMES: Winston Churchill's magnificent address before the Canadian Parliament contained for the first time a direct reference to Joseph Stalin. Stalin's brilliant and determined leadership accounts, of course, in no small degree for the turn of the tide on the Eastern Front which will go down in history as the "miracle of Moscow."
